file_content.text: It seems you have some skill, stranger. You are not the effete little warriors they usually send our way.
I suppose you were also the one who slew so many in the White Ridge Hills.
Your men are dead, buried in the snow. I am here.
Yes, that was me.
I had expected more hatred from a foe we have beaten and starved... but perhaps you are not from the outpost, are you?
No, them I know. You are something different. You do as I do. You compete to out-compete.
Captain Eth said it was a mistake to leave him alive.
I bring a message.
Ha! Well, I will not be snuffed out like a candle on a shelf. If I am defeated, it will be a fight to remember.
What do I have to do to get you to leave this planet?
What is it you want?
What's this? A genuine question from an Imperial? Interesting.
What I want is the thrill of living in adversity. To know that I do not survive, I excel. I compete to out-compete anyone, anywhere.
For you, I have a challenge.
What sort of challenge?
Name it.
Do your worst.
I will face anything.
I speak of the Crypt--where only the truly strong dare fight. Its fog will soak you through in seconds and steal all warmth from your body.
It is then we discover who we truly are.
Join me in battle. My lieutenants will fight your companions, and all will know that those who fell, fell nobly.
Join me in battle. One against one, fighting for our lives. Nothing is more pure--in this world or any other.
I think I'll just kill you now.
No deal. [Attack.]
Then we will meet in this Crypt.
You're on.
Yes. And there you will meet oblivion.
Shut up and die. [Attack]
I think not.
